awd_titl_txt: Conference: Support for Future Faculty Symposium at 60th Society of Engineering Science (SES) Conference; Minneapolis, Minnesota; 8-11 October 2023
awd_abstract_narration:
This award is to provide travel and registration support to 40 senior PhD students and postdocs to participate in the inaugural Future Faculty symposium in the 2023 Society of Engineering Science (SES) Technical Meeting that will be held in Minneapolis, Minnesota, 8-11 October 2023. This is the 60th installment of this conference with primary focus on mechanics, with participation of experts from various engineering disciplines, physical and life sciences, as well as mathematics. The symposium will have two components: a poster session and a fishbowl conversation panel, which will offer the prospects an opportunity to highlight their credentials and learn from various stakeholders, respectively, while forming valuable connections. Due consideration in the candidate selection process will be given to members of underrepresented groups and to diversity of institutions. The award will benefit the nation through the experiences gained by future faculty prospects who are expected to add to the skilled and diverse engineering workforce, better prepared for challenges of their chosen fields.
 
The objective of this symposium is to enable a diverse pool of faculty prospects to learn, network, and improve their chances for success in academia. In the first part of the symposium, the poster session will provide an opportunity for these prospects to highlight their research and education credentials to the conference participants. In the second part of the symposium, the fishbowl conversation panel will be attended by faculty of all ranks, department heads, and federal program managers, who will offer their advice and experience to the prospects on the application process, interview pitch and expectations, and transition. This event will provide significant visibility to the prospects, offer opportunity to network with mentors, and facilitate connection with employers. In return, the community will also be introduced to potential new leaders in the field. This first-ever event is designed to support the development of the workforce of tomorrow.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

por.por_cntn:
Conference Support for the Future Faculty Symposium in the 60th Society of Engineering Science (SES) Conference; University of Minnesota, MN; October 8-11, 2023

Award Number: CMMI- 2322824

Project Period: 6/1/2023-5/31/2024

PI: Kejie Zhao, Purdue University

Program Officer: Dr. Siddiq Qidwai

 

The goal of the project is to provide travel and registration support to 40 senior PhD students and postdocs to participate in the inaugural Future Faculty symposium in the 2023 SES Technical Meeting that was held in Minneapolis, Minnesota, 8-11 October 2023. This is the 60th installment of this conference with primary focus on mechanics, with participation of experts from various engineering disciplines, physical and life sciences, as well as mathematics. The qualifying process for the travel award was highly selective based on the resume, the one-page essay on the career plan, and confirmed participation in the poster symposium. The organizers prioritized the selection of travel awards to the qualifying underrepresented and minority students/postdocs. Each travel awardee was reimbursed the actual cost with a limit of $1000.

The symposium had two components: a poster session and a fishbowl conversation panel, which offer the prospects an opportunity to highlight their credentials and learn from various stakeholders, respectively, while forming valuable connections. In the first part of the symposium, the poster session provides an opportunity for the prospects to highlight their research and education credentials to the conference participants. 84 posters were exhibited in the poster session. In the second part of the symposium, the fishbowl conversation panel was attended by faculty of all ranks, department heads, and federal program managers, who offer their advice and experience to the prospects on the application process, interview pitch and expectations, and transition. Over a hundred audiences attended the fishbowl session. This symposium provides significant visibility to the prospects, offers opportunity to network with mentors, and facilitates connection with employers. In return, the community is also introduced to potential new leaders in the field. This first-ever event is designed to support the development of the workforce of tomorrow.

On the intellectual merit, the symposium provides a forum for senior PhD students and postdocs to present their research in front of hundreds of people in the audience. It significantly increases the visibility of the candidates’ research, bring up new ideas and potential breakthrough of barriers of their research, and promote the connections with their peers and mentors that can provide long-term benefits to their careers. Such a poster session of a focused theme is unprecedented in the SES conference and built the network and belonging to the home society of the next generation researchers at the early stage. In addition, the panel discussion provides valuable information about the perceptions of the faculty, hiring institutions, and funding agencies, which the students/postdocs are less exposed to. The information exchange will prepare the candidates with the best strategies for their applications for faculty positions.

On the broader impact, the symposium fostered strong participation by students/postdocs from underrepresented groups and from a diverse set of institutions and geographic regions. Role models from those groups were invited to the panel discussions. The symposium synergizes with the NSF’s goal in building, retaining, and recruiting a diverse and inclusive workforce in the mechanics of materials and structures community. The symposium streamlines the high-performing individuals in the academic careers, and potentially transform the recruiting dynamics between the candidates and the hiring institutes. 


Last Modified: 07/25/2024
Modified by: Kejie Zhao
